title: What would happen if, for example, Apple buys 50% of Samsung, and Samsung buys 50% of Apple, hypothetically? - Quora

response.answer_text: Samsung is the employment and technology arm of the South Korean government so not for sale in any manner. Samsung also makes everything from ships to seaweed snacks. Anyone can in theory launch a takeover of Apple - you would need to pay a premium for shares (Apple value around $1.5 TRILLION dollar market cap) so bring about $3 TRILLION dollars or $2 TRILLION to get a controlling interest. Larger than the ENTIRE GNP of South Korea. When Apple was at $1.3 trillion market cap, by raw numbers, “The nations with GDP figures immediately below $1.3 trillion are Mexico, Indonesia, The Netherlands, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and Switzerland.” So, it’s like asking if you can buy Mexico. At $1.3 Trillion, Apple Is Bigger Than These Things
Never happen. Unless one falls off the perch, and the other snaps up the now-cheap investment; but what for?
The two companies would merge and Apple products would be manufactured in South Korea. The company would rebrand as Apple.
